title: [FR] Add Neuraxle pipelines for easier pipelining

labels.name: help wanted
labels.description: We would like help from the community to add this support

labels.name: area/tracking
labels.description: Tracking service, tracking client APIs, autologging

labels.name: priority/backlog
labels.description: We believe it is useful, but donâ€™t see it being prioritized in the next few months.

body:
Related: https://github.com/Neuraxio/Neuraxle/issues/278

## Describe the proposal

See here: https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/models.html

We'd want to add these classes: 
- mlflow.neuraxle.save_model() 
- mlflow.neuraxle.log_model() 
- mlflow.neuraxle.load_model() 

This is of minimal impact, and extensible. 

### Motivation

Scikit-learn, created in 2007, lacks support for deep learning, AutoML, and has an inflexible API. For instance, it's impossible to serialize scikit-learn pipelines if they contain TensorFlow or some other external librairies in the steps of the pipeline. 

See our full list of problems of [using scikit-learn for deep learning and AutoML](https://www.neuraxio.com/en/blog/scikit-learn/2020/01/03/what-is-wrong-with-scikit-learn.html). 

Here are our [solutions to doing deep learning with scikit-learn-like-pipelines using Neuraxle](https://www.neuraxle.org/stable/scikit-learn_problems_solutions.html#). 

Here is an [example Neuraxle deep learning pipeline using TensorFlow](https://github.com/Neuraxio/Neuraxle#deep-learning-pipeline-definition). The ability to serialize tensorflow steps inside scikit-learn pipelines is a pain reliever as explained in the solution link above. 

### Proposed Changes

I explained this already in the title `Describe the proposal` above. 

Files to get inspiration from: 

- https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/mlflow/sklearn.py
- https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/mlflow/tensorflow.py

My only concern is that we don't save exactly 1 file like a pickle, but rather, many files with subfolders. May zip and unzip the whole thing if needed. 

See also: https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/python_api/mlflow.sklearn.html#module-mlflow.sklearn
